sources.title: Wives under Suspicion
sources.description: A prosecuting attorney treats every homicide case as first degree murder and uses miniature replicas of human skulls to tally the death sentences that he garners. Then he himself is beset by the urge to murder. An above-average public domain film from Universal Pictures.

sources.title: Wives Under Suspicion (1938) JAMES WHALE
sources.description:
PizzaFLIX Presents Classic Movie Monday
Director: James Whale
Starring: Warren William, Gail Patrick, Ralph Morgan, William Lundigan

When a ruthless District Attorney cancels a vacation with his wife to prosecute a crime of passion, he fails to notice that his life is moving in a disturbing parallel track with the defendant's -- a path likely to lead to an unspeakable tragedy.

TRIVIA: James Whale, the legendary director of FRANKENSTEIN, was so intrigued by this story he filmed it twice, earlier in 1933 as "The Kiss Before the Mirror."

sources.title: Wives Under Suspicion (1938)
sources.description: A merciless district attorney prosecutes a case that mirrors his own life. Watch on RetroFlix:Â  https://retroflix.org/wives-under-suspicion-1938/

metadata.Plot: A prosecutor trying a case where a husband shot his adulterous wife begins to suspect that his own wife is having an affair, and starts to have his own thoughts about killing her.
metadata.Actors: Warren William, Gail Patrick, Ralph Morgan
